Awww, I love you guys. God loves you guys.
Marianne gives Micah a strictly PG-rated kiss against his car. They're nauseatingly wholesome.

Olive is sitting in the office, dressed just as slutty as day before. A RED "A" sewn onto her top. Marianne is behind the desk, sharpening pencils. After ea one, she observes the point with a scary satisfaction. They exchange a few hateful glances at each other. Mrs. Griffin pokes her head out of her office.
Hey Olive. Wanna come in? 67. Olive, in no mood for this, drags herself up dramatically follows Mrs. Griffin into --
Mrs. Griffin sits behind her desk and Olive sits opposite her.
So, the reason I called you down here is just so that we could - sort of, y'know - chat about what's going on. (Beat.) There's been some concern from faculty members.
Your husband. Mrs. Griffin shifts uncomfortably in her chair. There's something a little unnerving about this kid's awareness.
Olive, you're attempting to make a statement. We get that. I'm just confused as to what exactly it is.
Am I in trouble? I promise the hem of my dress isn't higher than my fingertips.
You're not in trouble, Olive. I just wanted you to know that if there was something you maybe needed to talk about, that you could trust me.
If I open up to you, do you promise this stays in confidence?
Yes.
I watch `American Idol.' Do NOT tell anyone. 68. Mrs. Griffin rolls her eyes.
I have a reputation to uphold.
Don't you, though? Olive assesses this statement from her.
We done? If I can think of any angsty things to report, you'll be the first to know. She winks at her.
This has been so much fun that I'm actually - at this very moment - considering meth addiction, just so I can come back and we can jaw some more.
Or you could always get pregnant?
I'm probably closer than either of us thinks... Mrs. Griffin digs in her purse and pulls out a handful of CONDOMS. Feigning excitement --
Propho-tastic!
Please don't tell anyone I gave you these. The school board is --
Puritanical and oppressive?
Conservative. Olive sees that Mrs. Griffin is genuinely concerned.
I don't need those. 69.
But you do. Olive starts to confess, but then just takes the rubbers puts them in her own purse.
Thank you.
Remember: our little secret. And, hey, would you send in the next person? Mrs. Griffin smiles at Olive as she leaves.
Marianne is talking to Micah, who seems distressed. He ru his eyes, like he's been crying. Olive is surprised to se him there.
You're up, hoss.
(Concerned; To Micah) It's going to be okay. She gives him a reassuring smile and he walks into her office.
Let me guess: drugs. Marianne gives her a `go away' look.
I didn't know Christians believed in guidance counsellors. (Beat.) Ooo! Ooo! Is your boyfriend struggling with his sexuality? Marianne begins crying.
No, you insensitive rhymes-with- witch! His parents are going
divorce! She begins sobbing uncontrollably. Olive, not sure what t do, goes around the counter and hugs her. Marianne just cries on her shoulder.
It's okay, Marianne. (Not sure what to say) Sometimes our boyfriend's parents get divorced. It's just important to know that it's not your fault.
(Through her tears) They go to our church! Imagine what people will say! Olive didn't expect this embrace to last this long.
I have to go now. Are you going to be okay? Into Olive's shoulder --
Mrs. Griffin is going to fix everything. She's amazing. I know that she's going to help Micah through this time and everything's going to be okay.
Yeah. Everything's going to be okay. Marianne pulls away and wipes tears from her eyes.
Why are you being so nice to me?
Isn't that what we're supposed to do? Hey, it's your boss's rules. This triggers even more wails from Marianne , who grabs O and squeezes her tightly.
I'm sorry, okay? I'm sorry for everything I said.
I want to be friends. PLEASE. PLEASE be my friend. Olive is really confused by this display and is about to something snide, but thinks better of it and replies with very heartfelt --
Absolutely. Marianne pulls away again and manages to smile at her, warmly.
And for a day, we were actually really good friends. I was really starting to think that things were going to turn around.

location: HALLS OF BARBARA BUSH HIGH SCHOOL

text: Marianne, angry as hell, stomps through the hall with hat burning in her eyes and coursing through her veins.

But then I unwittingly gave her boyfriend a venerial disease... Marianne stops in front of Olive and slaps her so hard th people in the hallways stop, dead in their tracks. It's the slap heard `round the school.
Olive bursts into Mrs. Griffin's office. Tear-streaked, M Griffin is packing her things into a cardboard box. It's if her world has just collapsed.
...And caused the break-up of Mr. and Mrs. Griffin...
What?! What do you want? Olive starts to say something, but Mrs. Griffin can't eve look at her.

Just go! 72. She throws a framed photo of her and Mr. Griffin into the box. It shatters. Mrs. Griffin falls apart. Olive starts to say something again, but she doesn't know what to say, so she sheepishly turns to leave.
The Cross Your Heart Club is assembled outside of the sch with a lot of other kids (and some parents), waving signs wooden stakes that say things like:

head_text.subj: SCHOOLS ARE FOR LEARNING, NOT FOR WHORING

text: Rhi is among them, as riled up as any.
So, I guess I shouldn't be too shocked that these people wanted my diseased, home-wrecking ass out of there. The scene is a maelstrom of anger and piety.
Olive laughs.

The funny thing is: the whole time this shit was going down - people calling me something I knew wasn't true, my best friend included - I couldn't help but think how I could have come up with better signs. No one even bothered to use alliteration or, God forbid, irony - not even a single acronym - and that seems a lot more unforgivable than my sins. 73.
Olive enters a Catholic Church. It's empty, but there are few CANDLES burning. She sees the CONFESSIONAL BOOTH and makes a beeline toward it. She takes a deep breath and enters.
She sits down and begins to talk to the screen.

Forgive me, father, for I have sinned. I think that's how you're supposed to start these things. I'm only going on what I've seen in the movies. Then, I think I'm supposed to tell you how long it's been since my last confession, but that's kind of my first confession. I'm not Catholic. I really don't know what I'm supposed to do, except sit here in this booth and tell you what I've done wrong. Where do I even start? (Beat.) I've been pretending to be a -- how would one phrase it in Catholic words? A harlot. It's not like I've actually been doing the things that people are saying I'm doing, but - then again - I'm not denying them, so I've just been wondering: is that wrong? There's a lot of shi -- `crap' going down at my school which may or may not be indirectly because of this masquerade. (Beat.) I'm lying. I may have caused the end of a marriage. I thought, in my own perverse way, that I could help it. I mean, in my defense, I am merely an adolescent. I should never have been propositioned in the way I was propositioned by an adult. But then again, I should never have consented. It was just that a lot of people had been asking me to do things and I thought it was okay, because it wasn't real.
It was make-believe and no one was getting hurt. But a lot of people hate me now. I kind of hate me, too. There's a long silence. Olive tears up and wipes them awa
I could be wrong, but aren't you supposed to say something or ask me questions. Tell me to say `Hail Marys'? Hello? She looks through the screen. There's no one there.
Oh, come on! She throws the curtain to the booth open and stomps out.
Olive, upset at herself, gets into her car and drives off But just a few blocks down the street to --
She parks her car and gets out to try a different denomination.

Olive enters to find a SWEET, PORTLY RECEPTIONIST (50's) searching through RELIGIOUS CLIP-ART on her COMPUTER, attempting to find the perfect image for the church newsletter. The lady smiles, acknowledging Olive.
Hi. I was wondering if the minister was around.
Pastor McGreevey is on vacation this week. But our associate pastor is in. Would you like to speak to him? For her own entertainment, Olive matches the receptionist enthusiasm level. 75.
Actually, that would be fantastic!
Can I tell him what this is regarding?
Absolutely. I'm looking for a church to join and I thought he might be able to sell me on this fine establishment. The receptionist joyfully snatches up the phone.
Don, there's a young lady here who would like to speak with you about joining. She listens and then hangs up.
(Pointing to an office) You can go right in.
If everyone here is as friendly as you, I think we might be in business. She winks at the receptionist and enters --
ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON (40's) is a gangly, unattractive - borderline creepy - man. He invites Olive to have a seat.
Hello there, young lady. My name is Don. He extends his hand, which she shakes politely.
How can I help you today?
I'm new to the area. Looking for a church - hopefully something with a strong fellowship, a firm foot in the soil of...
divinity and was wondering what your church's stance on lying and adultery was? Don seems taken aback by the question.
Well. It's not a good thing.
Oh, I agree. Wholeheartedly. But tell me: assuming there is a hell --
Ma'am, the Presbyterian Church recognizes the existence of hell.
Right. Okay. Let's say hell exists. Which is worse - lying or adultery? Or is lying about adultery like a double whammy?

I'm sorry, ma'am, I -- What did you say your name was? At that moment, Olive looks at his desk and sees a FRAMED FAMILY PHOTO. Smiling big are Associate Pastor Don, his wife, A WOMAN WITH A SMILE THE SIZE OF MONTANA and his lo
She jumps up from her chair and recoils at the sight of t picture and the stupid mistake she made by coming there.
You know what. I think I'm just going to go and check out Judaism. Backing up toward the door.
The Jews and I have a lot in common. Fashion-wise. And stuff. So, thank you for your time. She bolts from his office.
Olive speaks into her webcam -- 77.

Yes. I had unwittingly sought advice from the father of the leader of my lynch mob. Who else can say that's happened to them? (Beat.) As much as I want to say I hate Marianne. I don't. I get her. Well, I get certain things about her. She's passionate. Like myself. She always thinks she's right. Like myself. And, yeah, I can kind of understand why she slapped me that day. Here's what happened...
Marianne, excitedly, runs over to Olive who is just getti to school and throws her arms around her.
Remember how I said that we were BFFs for, like, a day. Well, that's true. It was like we were sisters all of a sudden. Marianne can't seem to break the embrace and Olive just g with it.
Olive sits in class. Marianne passes a note back to her.

She wrote me a note in first period. Olive reads it. It says: Hey girlie! You wanna hang out after school today? Kisses! Marianne Marianne looks back and Olive gives her the thumbs up. Across the room, Rhi sees this exchange and sneers.
Marianne is working with her partner, Evan. She turns to Olive behind them and makes a gagging signal behind his b and laughs silently. 78.
By second period, it was like we had private jokes. Olive, unaware of how to respond, gives another thumbs up
Olive sees Marianne come into class, tear-streaked. She r over to Olive and again throws her arms around her.
Tragedy struck in third period.
Micah's in the hospital. He's in so much pain! The nurse didn't know what was wrong. Olive just holds her new friend, as she had the day befor
He'll be okay.
(Tears glistening in her
Really? Olive guides Marianne's head back to her shoulder.
Marianne's boyfriend, Micah, writhes in pain on a hospita bed, clutching his crotch. His worried MOTHER (40's) is beside him, clutching her chest with one hand and trying soothe him with the other.
It hurts so bad. A DOCTOR enters, with a satisfied smile and a diagnosis.
Chlamydia. Micah and his mother both look up in shock. His mother ta both of her hands and begins slapping him, uncontrollably 79.
How did you get chlamydia? Who have you been sleeping with? Tell me! TELL ME! Micah, in pain from the burning sensation and his mother' hands flying at astonishing speed shouts out:
Olive! Olive Penderghast! His mother's face fills with satisfaction.
Micah's mother is on her cell phone.
Olive Penderghast. She folds her phone up and slips it into her purse.

The woman on the other end of the phone -- A WOMAN WITH A SMILE THE SIZE OF MONTANA -- who we've seen in the Bryant family photo, hangs up. Only this time, her smile is a disgusted grimace. She picks up the phone and dials a number. She is, animatedly, talking to the person on the other end of the line, while Olive narrates.
Fourth period was when Marianne had office duty. Her duties included typing, stapling, filing and --
Marianne is on the phone, listening, with mouth agape. Undoubtedly, she's just heard from her mother that her boyfriend has chlamydia.
-- answering the phones.
She screams so loud that Mrs. Griffin comes out of her office, a panicked expression on her face.
Seething, Marianne's mother says into the phone --

head_text.subj: A WOMAN WITH A SMILE THE SIZE OF

text: Olive Penderghast. She hears a slam and then a dial tone.
Marianne clutches the phone in the cradle with enough for that it looks like the receiver will shatter in her hands Mrs. Griffin looks worried.
Are you okay, hon? Like a teapot about to start expelling steam, Marianne quivers in rage. Finally, at boiling point, she shouts --
But her long string of profanities is muffled by the long ringing of the school bell. Mrs. Griffin is taken aback b Marianne's umbrage. As we saw before --

location: HALLS OF BARBARA BUSH HIGH SCHOOL

text: Marianne, angry as hell, stomps through the hall with hat burning in her eyes and coursing through her veins.
Okay, I exaggerated. We were just BFFs for, like, a half-a-day. Marianne stops in front of Olive and slaps her so hard th people in the hallways stop, dead in their tracks.
(Clutching her face) MutherFUCKer! 81. Rhi, who was loading books in her locker, sees this and happily slams her locker shut. Breezing past her --
My sentiments exactly...
Oh, grow up! But Rhi keeps on walking.
Micah's on his cell phone, anxiously talking to someone - checking every few seconds to see if his mom is on her wa out.

(Into the cell phone) I didn't know what to say! I panicked! I said I got it from Olive Penderghast. (Pause.) I know, but what was I supposed to say?! And then my mom called her mom. (Pause.) No, not Olive's. Marianne's! (Pause.) I already tried to blame it on their divorce, but my mom's not buying it. I have to tell them. (Pause.) Okay. But I love you. I don't care if you gave me chlamydia. I LOVE YOU and I want to be with you and no one can stop us. Not my mother, not Marianne, not -- There's a dial tone.

Mrs. Griffin has just hung up on her teenage lover and be freaking out. She grabs a cardboard box and begins throwi items into it. Olive bursts into Mrs. Griffin's office and sees Mrs. Gri packing her things. As we saw before -- 82.
What?! What do you want? Olive starts to say something, but Mrs. Griffin can't eve look at her.

Just go! She throws a framed photo of her and Mr. Griffin into the box. It shatters. Mrs. Griffin falls apart. Olive starts to say something again, but she doesn't know what to say, so she sheepishly turns to leave -- -- and then feels awkward.

I'm sorry, I was just looking for Marianne. Did she say something about being mad at me? She just smacked the shi -- `crap' out of me. This makes Mrs. Griffin cry even harder. She attempts to pull herself together.
It's my fault. I'm so sorry, Olive. Olive looks at her, quizzically.
I fucked up. I fucking fucked up SO fucking bad. I'm a fucking.... Fuck.
Don't get me wrong. I love it, but I don't think you're supposed to use those words around a student.
Yeah, well, you're not to supposed to fuck them, either. But it didn't stop me. Olive puts two and two together in her head. She gasps a little louder than she planned. 83.
You and -- Oh my God. I'm not judging you or anything, but oh my God.
Wait. What does that have to do with me? Mrs. Griffin walks over and locks her office door. She fights back more tears, as she tries to explain to Olive.

My guidance counselor, who had only days before armed me with a latex bulletproof vest, told me that she had chlamydia and that she had been screwing around with her office aide's boyfriend under the guise of divorce counseling. She confided in me that she and her husband - my favorite teacher - were having marital problems, that they hadn't slept together in months. She assured me that she had never meant for anything to happen with Micah. She confessed to me how when she was a child she always dreamt of being Maria Von Trapp, not Mary Kay Letorneau. Micah had panicked and used me as a scapegoat - to save her job and her marriage. She assured me that she would make sure everyone knew the truth and apologized. Mrs. Griffin stops talking and waits for Olive to speak.
And I bought it. Olive gives her a reassuring smile, steps up to the plate offers up a solution.
I could have chlamydia. And I could easily have given it to Micah. That time we slept together. Who knows? Often times women don't have symptoms and I have been whoring around....
No you haven't. 84. Olive looks at her, puzzled by her knowledge.
Because a real whore can't admit it to herself, let alone others. She begins to weep. Olive puts her hand on Mrs. Griffin's shoulder.

Call Micah. Tell him I said he's an asshole and that he owes me SO big for this and also the time I pretended not to see him during a third grade game of hide and seek. Tell him I still remember that. But tell him that I confessed to giving him chlamydia. Mrs. Griffin grabs Olive and cries on her.

And it's not really my place to say this, but I figure after the conversation we just had, I can speak candidly. Your husband is HOT and while the male adolescent can fuck like a bunny... who really wants to fuck a bunny? If I was you, I'd go home and seduce him and pretend this never happened. Olive strokes her guidance counselor's hair.
Do you want some more condoms?
No, you keep them. She strokes her hair.
Into the webcam --
So, really how could I be angry at Marianne?
Dude, if some bimbo gave MY boyfriend an STD, I'd have swung, but I'd have balled my fist.
My boyfriend. (She gets lost in the

With all the mythical play I was getting, it's a wonder - and probably a miracle - that I still hadn't actually been asked out on a real date. Guys were clamoring to claim that they'd slept with me, but no one was putting the real moves on me. Until finally...
Two LITTLE 5 YEAR OLD GIRLS (Olive and Rhiannon) chase a LITTLE BOY all over the playground, desperate to kiss him They plot and plan to corner him, but he's just too fast.

It was really Rhiannon who had a crush on him. She has since we were kids. Rhiannon finally catches him and kiss him on the cheek. Repulsed, he wipes his face. Rhiannon and Olive high five each other.

Olive eats her lunch and yuks it up with a table full of guys. Rhiannon sits at a different table, mostly comprise of girls, and glares at her from across the room. The bell rings and the students begin getting up and maki their way toward the exit. Anson (who we saw earlier with Rhiannon in the hallways) approaches Olive.
Hey Olive. Olive smiles sweetly at him. 86.
I was wondering if you were busy tonight. Maybe wanna go out or something?
What did you have in mind?
I dunno. I was thinking about chartering a hot air balloon, taking along a bottle of champagne and fresh fruit and then trying to impress you with an overzealous reading of Emily Dickinson.
Why, Anson, are you inviting me to accompany you to a romantic dinner at the Red Lobster?
Unequivocally.
Nice. Yeah. I'll have dinner with you. Olive walks off
Olive and Anson sit in a booth at a dimly-lit RED LOBSTER Olive looks beautiful. The `A' on her shirt is sequined.
I can't believe you brought me to the nicest restaurant in town. This is swank. I was beginning to think that there was no such thing as class.
Yeah. What's better than getting to select your dinner and have nice conversation while they boil it alive in the back? 87.
I think Anson Jr. doesn't mind making the sacrifice. You don't mind that I named him Anson Jr., do you?
Not at all. I'm actually kind of honored.
Do you believe this whole thing about lobster being an aphrodisiac?
(Lying out his ass) I didn't know it was.

Y'know, medical science has not substantiated claims that any particular food increases sexual desire or performance. It's so funny when guys ply women with food that they think is gonna get them laid. I mean, what's really sexy about slurping back oysters? You know, native people believed that you gained the strength of the animal by consuming it. Some people grind up rhinoceros horn, because it's thought to stiffen the male sex organ. It's all bullshit. And spanish fly? It's pulverized beetle that people eat! Although, it's illegal for human consumption in the United States and do you know why? Because if you take just a bit too much, it causes painful urination, fever and bloody discharge. A SERVER appears with their LOBSTER. Anson is an odd shad of green from Olive's little science lesson.

Yum! The server leaves them and Olive digs in. Anson is feelin nauseous and can't touch his. From across the restaurant, a PARADE OF SERVERS enters fr the back, enthusiastically clapping and holding a cupcake 88. Leading the brigade is Meerkat Todd, who's wearing a RED LOBSTER HAT. With as much spirit, as he has as a meerkat --
I don't know but I've been told!
I don't know but I've been told! He leads them through to another part of the restaurant.
I didn't know Meerkat Todd worked here! And he's a lobster! I wonder if I should start calling him Lobster Todd.
Marguerite is getting old!

Marguerite is getting old! They land at the table of the birthday girl. Olive cranes her neck to see -- Rhiannon, miserable of course, sitting with her parents a table in the next room. Olive immediately becomes uneasy.
Shit!
The best thing is her dessert is free!
The best thing is her dessert is free!
The worst thing is I sing off-key!
The worst thing is I sing off-key! Olive is visibly squirming in her seat.
Sound off! 89.
Happy!
Sound off!
Birthday!
Sound off!
Happy birthday to you! The whole place applauds, unenthusiastically. Anson sees Olive's discomfort.
What's wrong?
Rhiannon's over there.
So?
So? She's been in love with you since the first grade.
So?
Well, she's my best friend.
I thought you two weren't speaking.
We're not, but it doesn't mean I should be out with you.
Then why are you?
I don't know. You asked me out?
Exactly. I have no interest in her. I mean, we're friends, but -- 90.
She can't see us.
Do you want me to get the check?
Would you mind? He gestures for the server who appears.
Could we get our check?
Is everything okay?
I just remembered I'm allergic to shellfish. I always forget that my respiratory system would collapse and I'd die. It sucks I know. Even more confused, the server obliges and gives them the check.
(Digging in her purse) Let me get it. I have a gift certificate. She pulls it out and hands it to the waitress, who leaves
But I asked you out.
And I ruined it, so let me bear the financial brunt. (Beat.) I'm so sorry about this. But she really likes you.
She and I just don't have much in common.
And you and I do? 91.
I think so. For instance, I, too think Nina Howell's a twat.
Yeah, well, if that's our magical connection, I should date the entire school.
Haven't you? Olive suddenly becomes self-conscious and a little bit pissed.
Kidding!
Yeah, about that -- The server reappears with the check.
You have a remaining balance of fourteen dollars and thirty six cents.
Keep it. Tip. The sever smiles and leaves them again.

Let's get out of here. They duck out of the booth trying to keep their heads dow but Olive can't resist the urge to look up and see if Rhiannon sees them. She does. Olive and Rhiannon make eye contact. Whereas, Olive looks remorseful, Rhiannon looks like she's just been stabbed i the back -- which she has. The Abernathys see her, as well, and wave. It's painfully obvious to Olive that Rhi hasn't told her parents about t differences. She starts to go over, but Rhiannon's face i turning vermillion in anger. Olive just waves, sheepishly and leaves with Anson. 92.
Olive's face is painted with guilt. She feels like shit, doesn't want to externalize it. Anson puts his hand on her knee.
I have something for you. Olive manages a smile. He reaches into his pocket and pul out a $500 GIFT CERTIFICATE to ANTHROPOLOGIE and hands it her. Olive is disappointed, but tries not to show it.
Oh. I didn't realize -- Snapping out of her guilt.
Okay. So, what did we "do" on this date?
Whatever $500 gets me. He leans over and kisses her. She pushes him off.
Wait. This isn't how it works. I don't actually -- But he's kissing her again, a little too forcibly. She pushes him off again.
You don't get it. I'm not technically having sex with people for money. You know that, right? Besides, even if I was, we're in the parking lot of a Red Lobster.
We can go wherever you want, but I think it would be kind of hot here. He takes off his shirt.
Dude, I gotta go. It's been -- sad. 93. She gets out of the car. He rolls down the window.
Olive, you're being stupid. I'll take you home.
No thanks. He drives off, leaving her outside in the parking lot.
Fuck. As luck would have it, Meerkat Todd, is coming out the ba exit. He sees her and gives her a surprised, toothy grin.
Hey Olive!
Hey Todd.
What are you doing here?
Oh, I'm just hanging out in the parking lot. I do that sometimes. Not necessarily just here. The one outside of Applebee's is fun, too.
(Laughing at her oddness) You want a ride somewhere?
Nah. I'm fine.
Your friend Rhi is inside. It's her Mom's birthday. Tears begin to glisten in Olive's eyes.
She's not my friend anymore. Todd walks over and puts his arm around her and leads her his car. He opens the door for her and she sits down. 94.
Olive is trying to pull herself together but she can't st crying as Todd drives her home. Todd doesn't know what to say to her. Finally --
You wanna talk about it?
What's to say? I'm a horrible person. Everyone thinks I'm a whore and, for the first time, I'm starting to believe it.
Huh?
Oh, don't act like you don't know what people are saying about me.
I know what people are saying. Doesn't mean I believe them.
Why not?
Olive, contrary to popular belief, I'm not an idiot. I know exactly what's going on and I know exactly what you're doing. She stops crying.
Who told you?

No one had to tell me. All I know is once upon a time, there was a scared little kid in a closet at a party who wasn't ready for his first kiss and there was this amazing little girl who lied for him. She smiles through her tears.
You remember that? 95.
Yeah and after I ran out, you pulled Brandon in. Yeah, I know about that, by the way.
And look how he turned out.
Sometimes I still pretend you were my first kiss.
Yeah? Who was?
Your friend. Rhiannon. Olive's laughter turns to rage.
What!?
Yeah. About a year later. It sucked.
(Blurting it out) She knew how I felt about you!
How do you feel about me?
She did it first! And here I am feeling SOOOO bad and THAT BITCH!
Wait. How do you feel about me?
Felt! I said FELT!
Oh. He stops the car. They're at her house. 96.
(Off his look) I mean, it's not that I don't still feel that way. There's an awkward moment between them.
Olive. If I promise not to tell anyone, could I kiss you? Despite the fact that this is positively the most romanti moment of her young life, Olive looks down.

No. Not tonight. I don't want you to kiss me when mascara's running down my cheek or some shithead has forced his tongue down my throat only a half-hour ago. I've wanted to kiss you since the eighth grade, but I want it to be perfect. And right now, my life's a mess. I need to get it under control before I drag you into it.
What if I told you I wanted to be dragged into it? Maybe I could help. He holds out his hand and she takes it.
Now I have a reason to fix this catastrophe I've brought upon myself. And I'm going to.
Okay. He smiles his goofy grin and she embraces him. She hops o of the car and goes to her front door.
Into her webcam --
You see, now I had a reason for things to go back to the way that they were.

The truth needed to be told and I knew I had to go the one person who could help me. The one person I could count on to set the story straight. Brandon. I'd helped him and, even though it would destroy his new reputation for being a stud, I knew he would help me.

location: HALLS OF BARBARA BUSH HIGH SCHOOL

text: Filling the frame, a GOSSIPY GIRL in braces says --

Oh my God, did you hear that Brandon ran away from home? Yeah. Totally. He left his parents a note that said: `Eff you, I'm gay.' And then he skipped town with a big, hulking black guy. We spin around to see Olive's stunned reaction.
My apologies to Mark Twain.
Huh? The reality of the situation begins to weigh on her.
Nothing. Defeated, Olive makes her way through the crowded halls.
It gets worse. Due to his `condition,' Micah was sent on an extended visit to his grandparents in Mississippi.
Micah, beyond miserable, sits between his STERN GRANDPARE who read the Bible to him. 98.
No telephone, no television, no computer, no internet and - most importantly - no diseased sexual partners. Micah settles in for a very long visit.
Where they had previously met, Olive pleads with Evan.
I went to everyone I'd helped and begged them to say it wasn't true.
No way. I gave you money.
Please, Evan. He walks off, leaving her alone.
Olive waits for Mrs. Griffin's response. There's a long moment of contemplation on Mrs. Griffin's part. Then --

Olive, life is full of choices. I made a bad one. But then, so did you. We both acted unwisely, but I don't see any other alternative than to live with the guilt. My guilt stems from my indiscretion, yours for lying. We've made our choices. Now, we have to ride them out.
(Pissed as hell) Or I could just tell everyone THE TRUTH.
Fine, Olive. Let's play the `who do you believe' game. But, first, ask yourself, if you were an adult, who would you believe? 99.
With all due respect, Mrs. Griffin, you're a fucking cunt.
Because you helped me once, I'm not going to report that to Principal Gibbons. Now, we're even. They're locked in a Mexican standoff.
You can go now. Furious, Olive throws the door open and exits.
Mr. Griffin is erasing the blackboard, when Olive storms the room.
Your wife has chlamydia and she's been sleeping with a student and she gave it to him and now she's trying to blame me. Shocked, Mr. Griffin drops the eraser.
What? The gravity of what she's just done sinks in and she stumbles.
I -- I'm sorry. I -- Not knowing what to say, she runs from his classroom.
Olive is mirthless, as she proceeds with her story.
Looking back, that's the thing I regret the most. That's the thing that sent me to the church, er, churches. And that's the thing that made me realize how profoundly I'd fucked up.
And that's something I'll have to live with for the rest of my life. With my words, even though they were true, I ended a marriage. No kid should have to be burdened with that. She contemplates this.

As we saw before, Olive sits and plays `CONNECT FOUR' wit Mr. Griffin, at his desk. Both are looking beaten down an very depressed and their minds are on everything but the game. Mr. Griffin puts his hand on Olive's.
It's not your fault. Olive gets a tear in her eyes. She puts a RED CHIP in at top and loses the game. She reaches over and presses the lever, causing all of the chips to fall on his desk.
There's a ridiculously tall tower of blocks and they all down.
He rakes the chips and the game into his own cardboard bo full of his things. He smiles and she hugs him -- intensely, tears quickly welling up in her eyes.
I'm so sorry.
No. It's not your fault. They just hold each other. Finally, Mr. Griffin pulls awa and takes his things and starts to leave. But then he tur and says -- 101.
I hope that you and Todd end up okay.
Me too. Where are you going?
Not sure yet. Away from her.
Can I come? They share one last, pained smile and he leaves.
Hearfelt, into the webcam --

Mr. Griffin, if you ever see this, just know - I was wrong to tell you that. In that way. At all. I don't know. I shouldn't have done it. I don't feel bad for lying for your wife. But I hate myself for telling you the truth. I'm so sorry. She wipes away a tear, pulls herself together.
Part Five: Not With a Whimper But With a Bang.
As we saw before -- The Cross Your Heart Club is assembled outside of the sch with a lot of other kids (and some parents), waving signs wooden stakes that say things like:

head_text.subj: SCHOOLS ARE FOR LEARNING, NOT FOR WHORING

text: Rhi is among them, as riled up as any. 102. Olive steps out of the school to see the demonstration. h jaw drops.
Oh fuck me. Things have gotten WAY too out of hand.
Olive cries on her bed, clutching her teddy bear. Rosemar listens, as a good mother does.
So, now everyone who knows the truth is either gone or won't fess up. The Cross Your Legs Club is demanding my head. And the messed up thing is that I wouldn't put it past Gibbons to expel me.
I had a similar situation when I was your age.
Everyone called you a whore?
Yes. I had a horrible reputation and people said awful things about me. But it was true. I was a slut. Olive gives her a suspicious look.
I'm waiting for you to say (Imitating her mother) `Just kidding!'
No, it's true. I slept with a whole bunch of people.
Mom!
Well! It was a different time. 103.
Ewwww!
I did. I got around. Before I met your father, I was a garden variety floozy.
Why are you telling me this?
Because I endured a similar lynching because of a certain dalliance.
I promise that it was no worse than Marianne Bryant's attack on me.
Wanna bet? It was her mother.
Wait, what?
Yep. Don Bryant and I got caught in a very compromising position in the locker room during a basketball game.
That's disgusting! He's disgusting!
He wasn't back then. He was actually pretty handsome. All I'm saying is that MAYBE the reason that Bryant girl is going after you is because her mother told her about me.
So, the sins of the mother are revisited on the daughter.
There's something else you should know. This is hard to say but -- Don Bryant is your father. Marianne is your sister. 104. Olive turns white.

Kidding!! Well, about the sister thing, but not about the Don thing. That happened. Actually that happened a couple of times before we got caught. Olive punches her mother on the arm, who's laughing hysterically.
I hate you so much right now. Can't you see I'm a mess!
No, you're not, Olive. You're wonderful. And you're going to handle this the same way that I did. With an incontrovertible sense of humor. They embrace and Olive gets an idea.
Thanks for the pep talk, Mom. Now get out. I need to make some phone calls. Rosemary looks slightly concerned by the grin on Olive's face.
We join a pep rally, already in progress. The DANCE TEAM attempts to rile up the school with a rous rendition of Michael Jackson's `BAD.' In the stands, Rhi sits with Marianne and Nina.
So, Olive wasn't at school today. She extends her palms to Nina and Rhi, who both slap them Marianne puts her arm around Rhi.
I'm so glad you're with us now.
Me too. You guys fucking rock. 105.
We don't say that word, Rhiannon.
Just say `effing' instead. We effing rock. Marianne nods in agreement, however Rhi is confused.
But isn't that just implying the same word?
Oh, Rhiannon. We have so much to teach you. It's okay to imply things. Rhiannon looks at her new best friends, who just smile at her. The song ends and there's a drum roll.
Yay! It's time for Meerkat Todd.
I just want to rip that costume off him and -- Marianne puts her hand firmly on Rhi's knee.

Why don't you just not talk for a while, okay hon? Rhi puts her head down. The drum roll ends and Meerkat Todd bounces out in costum He jumps around enthusing the student body -- But then he goes out of the gym and reenters pushing a DUMPSTER. The familiar chords of the James Bond theme `Nobody Does Better' plays from the band. Meerkat Todd opens the lid of the dumpster and Olive, dre in a glittery and slinky RED DRESS, with a BOA draped aro her bare shoulder, pops up and croons with a handheld mic slightly different lyrics: 106.
Nobody does it better. Makes me feel sad for the rest. Nobody does it half as good as me. Baby, I'm the best. Todd lifts Olive out of the dumpster and she sings her as off - and she's quite good.

I wasn't lookin,' But somehow they found me. I tried to hide from Your love light. But like heaven above me The guys who loved me Are keepin' all my secrets safe tonight. She winks at the audience. The guys begin to wolf whistle and howl at her sheer brilliance. She begins to rub her hands seductively over Meerkat Todd furry costume, eventually unzipping it and taking off the head to reveal: BLUE DEVIL TODD! The crowd goes wild.

And nobody does it better Though sometimes I wish someone could. Nobody does it quite the way I do. Why'd I have to be so good? She saunters over to Rhi and kisses her on the cheek, lea a big, red lip mark.

The way that they hold me Whenever they hold me There's some kind of magic inside you. That keeps me from runnin', But just keep it comin'! How'd you learn to do the things you do? She sees that Gibbons is not amused, but that doesn't sto her.
Oh, and nobody does it better. Makes me feel sad for the rest.

Nobody does it half as good as me. Baby, baby! Darlin', I'm the best! She walks over to a couple of HORN PLAYERS, and runs her fingers seductively over their (uh) instruments. The crowd goes wild - some appalled, but most enthused. Olive sashays through the crowd as the MALE TEENS scream stuff money down her bodice.
Baby you're the best! Darlin', you're the best! Baby, you're the best! The song ends and Olive takes Blue Devil Todd's hand.

(To the student body) This is just a free preview. For the main event log on to www.freeolivep.com tonight at 6 p.m. Now, I know this conflicts with tonight's basketball game, but c'mon would you rather be here cheering on the Meerkats (Looking at Todd,
or watch me do one. There are audible gasps, but excitement nonetheless. Gibbons angrily storms over and takes the microphone.
(Through gritted teeth) Young lady, to my office. NOW.
Yeah, I can't. I'm gonna go bang my boyfriend while the whole school watches. But good luck with the game-thing. Go Meerkats. She plods out, triumphantly.
The sun is setting as Olive speaks into her webcam. But t time, we're not seeing it through the lens, but from a different point in the room. 108.

And here you all are. Waiting outside the closet door for me to kiss Todd, listening to me pretend to have sex with Brandon, paying me to lie for you, calling probably the last virgin in school a whore. Guys. Seriously. All of a sudden -- from outside and downstairs -- James' `LAID' begins to play. Olive goes over to the window and sees Todd below, holdin a BOOMBOX (a la John Cusack) and there's a RIDE-ON LAWN M (a la Patrick Dempsey) behind him. Upon seeing this, she bursts into laughter, but it couldn be more romantic.
Who told you that I loved this song?
I guessed.
I see you've been watching my live webcast. It's still going on, you know.
Fuck them. They've had enough of you. Well, figuratively speaking. I borrowed my neighbor's John Deere. Come down here.
That rhymed.
Intentionally.
Be right down. Olive can't get the smile off of her face as she goes bac the camera. We see her through the lens. 109.

That's Todd. Not that I owe any of you any more confessions, but I'm really in love with him. And I am going to lose my virginity to him. I'm not sure when. It could happen five minutes from now or tonight or six months from now or maybe on our wedding night, but the really amazing thing is that it's nobody's business. (As an afterthought) Like, totally. She turns the camera off.
Olive runs out of the house and tackles him, kissing him in the front yard, in broad daylight, for the world to see. FADE OUT. OVER THE END CREDITS...
The basketball game is going on to an almost empty gymnas

We see, from the perspective of their computer screens, various reactions to Olive's webcast -- -- A proud Brandon watches from a hotel room. A MUSCULAR BLACK GUY in a towel comes up behind him and kisses his n -- The Abernathys watch with the same demented glee they derive from watching anything. -- Mrs. Griffin watches with the face of a person who's b found out and who's days are numbered. They are. 110. -- Rhi seems contemplative. Maybe it's because she's been love with Olive since grade school. Duh. -- Evan, the fat kid, is doing jumping jacks while watchi -- Melanie Bostic (the host of the party) watches with a group of girls.
Told you guys. Pay up. -- Marianne feels regret. But a little bit impressed. -- Mr. Griffin is proud of her. -- Micah watches in his dark bedroom.
Micah? What are you doing in there?

You had better not be on the sin- ternet. -- Rosemary and Dill are too busy making out to watch. -- Anson has a jar of vaseline and is ready to jerk off, is upset that she isn't `exposing herself' in the aforementioned way.
I thought she was going to take her clothes off.
Olive and Todd are still kissing on the lawn underneath t stars. FADE OUT.
